data.title: Great downtown dinner
data.text: This restaurant is located in the square of downtown Ft Worth. So much to see. We are on the patio and has a bistro view of the city. The service was great and the food was delicious. Views from the patio included.

data.title: Cheesecake is cheesecake
data.text: This Cheesecake is a bit more "melinnial" set. Food is Cheesecake expectation. Within walking distance downtown. As Cheesecake is - a bit overrated.

data.title: Trade show visit
data.text: The restaurant was very clean, the staff were competent and attentive. Food was well prepared and the servings were very generous; maybe too much food per potion.   Cost was $$ very appropriate for the meal.  The only true down side, was the amount of dishes to choose from. I believe there were 5 pages to choose from. How can they keep and prepare that variety?

data.title: Convienent after Bass Hall Performance
data.text:
We stopped in for a late lunch after attending a matinee performance of Phantom of the Opera at Bass Performance Hall. Great location right across the street!

Despite everyone coming over to eat after the concert we did not have to wait long to be seated but service did start out very slow. However, it worked out okay for us... 1st, because we were not in a hurry and 2nd, because they ended up not charging us for our appetizer since it took them so long to get it to the table.We actually had 2 managers visit our table to offer their apologies.

My husband and I shared the Garlic Noodles which was huge and quite yummy. My son had one of the steaks. He said it was very good. It was a nice size steak and the portion of broccoli and potatoes were enormous. His friend had the Terriyaki chicken which must have come from one big bird! She said it was good as well.
The only one of us who was not impressed with their meal was my daughter. She had a cheeseburger which she thought tasted burnt. She can be picky sometimes so I thought it might just be because it was charcoal grilled. At any rate, next time they ask how we would like a burger cooked I will be sure to only order well rather than well done. Thankfully, she did enjoy her french fries!

The waitress was very attentive and earned a good tip for her efforts. Really appreciated her boxing up our leftovers for us to take with us.

data.title: Lite On Service - Not On Food.
data.text: I walked in just shy of the 5pm happy hour, blue gray crowds seeking an earlier dinner. The hostess decided to seat me in the bar area small booth & hi topper tables. Anyway, I must of caught the kitchen off guard on the pre-meal nice warm fresh bread. Because it wasn't prepared and I never did get any after mentioning it twice to the waiter. Oh well, another lackluster American service institute of "Eh... That's all you get kind of service attitude!" Food was as always, good sized portions. They should be for the price of sixteen bucks. Incidentally, this is probably NOT the place to come IF you're trying to watch your waistline! Cheesecake Factory's main signature is that, they excel at cheesecake varieties!

data.title: Mmmmm ...
data.text: We always seek out a Cheesecake Factory when we travel because we don't have one in home area.   We also try to be a bit adventurous & order something we've never had.  Tonight our new choice was an appetizer, Avocado Portabello & Zucchini "fries". This was a good choice!  Clean atmosphere and very courteous staff. Very generous portions

data.title: Happening Place!
data.text:
This place is always busy...always. So plan accordingly and make reservations.  You show up and expect to be seated soon, not going to happen. When dinning don't be in a hurry.  Enjoy the time to chat. Service is good, but not great and that is due to the overwhelming presence of customers.

All the food is great, They have carry out.

I laugh about the name, The Cheesecake Factory.  After you eat all the good food and the large portions they give you...there is no room for a cheesecake.

data.title: Fantastic food
data.text:
We called in at The Cheesecake Factory having visited only once before. I ordered a Greek salad to start, which had just the right amount of rocket, cucumber, onion, tomato and feta cheese. My husband opted for crab cakes with a mustard dressing which he said were delicious. 
For mains I opted for the "everything pizza" which was light and crispy and smothered in topping. Hubby opted for chicken white bean chilli which was spicy but not too hot. The only complaint was that it was a little runny. We completed the meal with a bottle of Chardonnay. 
Our server was polite and chatty with just the right amount of attention although it would have been nicer if I'd been allowed to finish my starter before being served my main course. 
Sadly we didn't have room for Cheesecake so once again we shall have to return in order to try them out. We did see the next tables though and they looked huge!
Overall verdit-delicious food and good value for money

data.title: Poor lunch service
data.text:
I was Alil disappointed coming to this location during Lunch time. The service is what really disappointed me about this visit...

So we arrived about 1:59 pm on a Monday to found just one table of two lady's.. Upon looking around I notice they had about maybe 8 waiters on staff and some type of staff gathering in one of the far away booths..

So with that been said I see the cooks out of the kitchen ... The wait staff just having a ball and I still haven't received my food!!! 

Food finally came 46 mins upon arriving I get my Luke warm food... Took forever to get my food especially since nobody was there !!!! ???? 

I wasn't pleased at all and the funny part I've been here on a weekend, an have received my food much faster ??? How is this possible???

SERVICE THAT DAY WAS A FAIL.COM 

*i guess ill stick to going on weekends now*

data.title: Good food.
data.text: We had to stop by while we were in town and we weren't disappointed.  The food is a bit more than we like to spend.  About $125 for 3 people is a bit much in my opinion but maybe it's just me.  The food is good and the polenta cakes are my favorite!  The service was great and I will go back.  Just wish it wasn't so much money.

data.title: Great food and priced very well. I ate there 2 times in a three day visit to the area.
data.text: Great food and at a great price too!! I ate here 2 times in a 3 day visit to the area. I had the salmon on my first visit and a hamburger on the 2nd visit. Both meals were cooked to perfection and tasted great. You will not be disappointed. I did not try any of the deserts, I wanted to though.

data.title: Sweetness
data.text: The food is very good. There is a ton of variety for everyone. Of course the dessert is awesome. Great location in downtown Fort Worth!!

data.title: Great Chain with Delicious Food
data.text: I stopped here with a friend after walking around Sundance Square for a bit. The wait was really busy but there were two seats at the bar so we lucked out. We were able to order our cheesecake at the bar. It was delicious as always. If you've never been here the variety of cheesecakes you can select is so impressive!!!

data.title: Huge chain
data.text: Not the place to go if your on a diet because the name tells you the great deserts. The menu is long and the dishes are large. Great for feeding a large family wanting leftovers.

data.title: A worthwhile experience
data.text: Cheesecake factory has a great reputation.  This new one in a terrific location has nice appointments, quality food, but the service in all fairness was slow and inconsistent.

data.title: Not out for show at the Bass
data.text: While I love the food and the variety and I haven't eaten anything bad, the atmosphere is too noisy and they seat you right upon the next patron. This is what keeps me from coming back more than once every 2-3 years. It's too congested for anyone who is handicapped or uses a walker, like my mother. The noise is so bad you can't hear yourself talk or even the waitress. Our waitress was good but I felt rushed. Not a relaxing atmosphere, nor time.

data.title: Good experience
data.text: This Location was smaller than some other locations. We were seated immediately. The server was a little slow getting to us and was somewhat negative to some menu items that appealed to us but not her.  We ordered the item anyway and it was good. The food had good flavor and overall good experience.

data.title: Wife's Favorite
data.text: Huge menu. The bar has yummy drinks but it's hard to get a drink or get bar seating before you being seated for dining. All the entrees are wonderful, and of course the cheesecakes are world class. Plan for at least a 30 minute wait to be seated. But at this location you can enjoy the pavilion at Sundance Square while you are waiting.

data.title: Maybe better next time
data.text: Just stopped in for a late afternoon appetizer while we visited with family member. Told the waiter I could not have bread or wheat on anything when we ordered crab and artichoke dip, which arrived with bread crumbs on top. Try again, this time the mixture was swimming in orange grease. A different waitress showed up and handled things. We finally got the dip without issues. It was ok, but not worth the wait or hassle. No offer to comp the appetizer was made. Disappointing for CF.

data.title: What's Not to Like
data.text:
The food is always good and of course you can order your favorite dessert. The Cheesecake Factory is always delicious.
Whether it is a couple on date night or large group there is something definitely for everyone. Since it opened a year ago it remains busy. But they seat you fairly quickly. It is a large establishment. The outdoor seating is awesome complete with heaters in the winter and fans for the hot summer days. A great place to go after a movie or the symphony they are both right across the street. A free parking garage is to the East of the restaurant. Double plus!!!!!(after 5 of course)
